name: xorexmid

body.origin:
|- wxo(w0, wn(w0))
-| wn(wb(w0, wn(w0)))
-| wb(wxo(w0, wn(w0)), wn(wb(w0, wn(w0))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wxo(w0, wn(w0))
-| wn(wb(w0, wn(w0)))
-| wb(wxo(w0, wn(w0)), wn(wb(w0, wn(w0))))

|- wxo(w0, wn(w0))
-| wb(wxo(w0, wn(w0)), wn(wb(w0, wn(w0))))

comment: Exclusive-or variant of the law of the excluded middle ( ~ exmid ). This statement is ancient, going back to at least Stoic logic. This statement does not necessarily hold in intuitionistic logic. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 23-Feb-2019.)
